field.name: summary
field.value: Support svc-less services hosted in IIS

field.name: description
field.value: Provide ability to work with just WCF Facility set up and not having to create .svc files which are very boilerplate anyway...

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: We might use the routing for that. Not sure if that works in WCF 3.5sp1

comment.author: cneuwirt
comment.text: yes, I think that would be a good idea

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Would that work on older WCF versions? (3.5sp1)?

comment.author: cneuwirt
comment.text: Docs seem to limit api to 4.0 or greater so I suspect not. Will have to try it with that environment I guess

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
There are docs for v3.5 http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.web.routing.routecollection(v=vs.90).aspx and I have a friend who claims that he built a web-forms app on 3.5 with it. Not sure if WCF requires anything beyond bare routing to work with it.
If not I think it's still worth it. Worst case scenario we conditionally compile it so that it's only .NET 4+ feature.
